page.title: 17ST.MARY'S CHURCH, CLIFFSEND
page.content: This church was built in 1871 as a Methodist Chapel and was used up until the 1940's. After the War it was no longer used and so it was bought by the Church of England in 1956 and in the 1980's it was altered to give a porch and vestry at the back. {THE SERVICES: There are three services on a Sunday {Holy Communion 9.00 a.m. {Family Service 10.00 a.m. {Evensong 6.30 p.m. The first marriage to take place at St. Mary's took place this year (1985) as before this marriages could only be solemnised with permission from the Archbishop. The Church, now that it has its own incumbant Rev.Clinton Davies, has become a thriving focal point again for religion at Cliffsend.
